result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk: Amy.

Defendant makes arguments re: rights.  
COURT makes findings and believes time has passed to get SPD and questions deft re: county appointment of counsel.  Deft understands and is in agreement.  

Court appoints Attorney Thomas Roley @ $100/hr. not to exceed $2500.00 without further order of the Court.

No contact with victim(s):  D.Z.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.    No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.    Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.    Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
